acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96-hour LC50=12000microg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows) (AQUIRE, 2003).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
The substance was classified as Category 3, because the LD50 in rats was 115mg/kg in RTECS (2004).
[Note] Since there is little health hazard data for the anhydride of potassium antimonyl tartrate (CAS No.11071-15-1), we performed the investigation and classification by treating the substance as the trihydrate (CAS No.28300-74-5).

carcinogenicity.rationale: It is classified into 2B as antimony compounds in industrial hygene academic society advice (2005). It was classified into Category 2.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 3, since acute toxicity was Category 3, and it is a metallic compound, behavior in water and bioaccumulative potential are unknown.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: UNRTDG is classified into 6.1 and III according to the UNRTDG No. (1551). Since 4.1 was not assigned, it was considered as out of Category.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The chromosome aberration inducement by the rat equivalent to somatic cell in vivo mutagenicity test (RTECS, 2004), and the chromosomal abnormality to the patient's lymphocyte medicated with this product were seen. So it was set as Category 2.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not classified because of UNRTDG No. 1551, Class: 6.1, III (not Class: 4.2)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Not classified because of UNRTDG No. 1551 Class: 6.1, PG III (not Class: 4.2)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although in HSFS (2004) and SITTIG (4th, 2002) there is eye irritation, the data which is supported is not found, and data is insufficient. Hence it cannot be classified.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since it is supposed that there is skin irritation (HSFS (2004) and SITTIG (4th, 2002)) and there also the statement that the this product in ointments indicates mild irritation in early stages of use (a rash is produced in long-term uses) (HSDB (2005)), it was set as category 3.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (the water solubility is obtained)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (lung, cardiovascular system)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since, in ACGIH-TLV (2005) of Priority 1 document, it is supposed that it has the effects on the lungs and the cardiovascular system by as an antimony compounds and there is description of the influence into the lungs and the heart of humans also (HSDB(2005), HSFS (2004) and SITTIG (4th, 2002) of Priority 2 document), it was classified into Category 1 (lungs, cardiovascular system). Moreover, in HSFS (2004) of and SITTIG (4th, 2002) Priority 2 document, there is the description of influence to human liver, so it was classified into Category 2 (liver). (The effects on the liver was observed also in the test of rabbit and rat, and the dose as which toxicity was observed was within the range of Category 2 in comparison with a guidance value (HSDB (2005) and RTECS (2004)).)

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is a report in ACGIH-TLV (2005), a Priority 1 document, that in the form of an antimony compound it has airway irritant properties. The substance was classified as Category 1 (respiratory system) because there is also a report in SITTIG (4th, 2002), a Priority 2 document, of its airway irritant properties and pulmonary edema after exposure at a higher concentration.
